issue.title: AdGuard Annoyances filter sets google.com CONSENT cookie on chrome://whats-new/

labels.name: Stale
labels.description: The issue is considered as obsolete

issue.body: ### Prerequisites - [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [X] Browser version is up-to-date; - [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard Browser Extension ### AdGuard version 4.0.163 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Annoyances â€” pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc. ### Which browser(s) do you use? Chrome ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? chrome://whats-new/ ### What filters do you have enabled? AdGuard Annoyances filter ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots The AdGuard annoyances filter causes a CONSENT cookie to be set for google.com whenever I open chrome://whats-new/ (which happened for example after I updated to Chrome version 102). This is despite the fact that I have google.com set under "Sites that can never use cookies" on chrome://settings/cookies If I disable the AdGuard annoyances filter, then this issue does not occur. ### Privacy - [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
Cannot reproduce with your settings.
Please try to disable-enable content blockers in Safari settings and restart Safari, and check for filters update.
Do not close AdGuard window 30-60 seconds, because iOS will breaks configuration process.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: clustrmaps.com
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard DNS

### AdGuard version

NextDNS filter 

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://clustrmaps.com/

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, AdGuard Russian filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1.  Data brokers and people-search sites are a gross and deeply concerning industry, but they aren't explicitly tracking or advertising per se.

If we want to get our info removed from these sites/databases (and everyone should!), it's necessary to visit the site to do so - but we can't if your filter is blocking the entire site categorically.

2. Screenshots

<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

https://imgur.com/a/Przc1cx

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot 2:</summary>

https://imgur.com/a/UzM0A2O

</details>

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
I'm not sure if it should be unblocked.
Description from their website (about their widget):
>Each visitor shows up as a dot on your map **with their current location**. **We keep track if they are a new or returning visitor.**

So, it looks like a tracker and it seems that it's used on many websites - https://publicwww.com/websites/%22clustrmaps.com%22/

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: [Samsung Internet] Issue with Adguard List-KR Filter List
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Content Blocker

### AdGuard version

2.7.0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

other(specify in comment below)

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

Naver

### What filters do you have enabled?

---Third-party filters---

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

When enabling List-KR filter list and AdGuard adblocker on Samsung Internet and accessing Naver site, the button with phone icon does not navigate to the device Phone app. This issue can be replicated as follows:

 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15856304/171390222-9617c2c7-0534-479c-9470-ee16285c85e4.png)


1. Open Samsung Internet and enable Adguard with List-KR enabled
2. Go to m.naver.com, type "ì‚¼ì„±ì „ìž ì„œë¹„ìŠ¤ì„¼í„° ì „í™”ë²ˆí˜¸" in the search bar and click the Search button/press Enter
3. Click on business phone icon. Normal behavior redirects to the device Phone app. Issue behavior, no actions occur. Please see screenshot of the business phone icon below:

 In our investigation, we have found that this is likely caused by the following filter rule:

||ssl.pstatic.net/tveta/libs.

 

We believe it is blocking a network resource allowing this functionality, specifically the following file: https://ssl.pstatic.net/tveta/libs/ssp/ssp.web.sdk.js.

Whitelisting the entire domain (ie. @@||ssl.pstatic.net) manually fixes this issue.

We would like to ask if you could please investigate this further as we are receiving comments from users asking why the phone button is not working in Naver search.

Please let us know if there are any further updates regarding this matter.

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

issue.title: [Samsung Internet] Issue with Adguard List-KR Filter List

labels.name: List-KR
labels.description: Problematic issues, handled in List-KR

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Content Blocker

### AdGuard version

2.7.0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

other(specify in comment below)

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

Naver

### What filters do you have enabled?

---Third-party filters---

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

When enabling List-KR filter list and AdGuard adblocker on Samsung Internet and accessing Naver site, the button with phone icon does not navigate to the device Phone app. This issue can be replicated as follows:

 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15856304/171390222-9617c2c7-0534-479c-9470-ee16285c85e4.png)


1. Open Samsung Internet and enable Adguard with List-KR enabled
2. Go to m.naver.com, type "ì‚¼ì„±ì „ìž ì„œë¹„ìŠ¤ì„¼í„° ì „í™”ë²ˆí˜¸" in the search bar and click the Search button/press Enter
3. Click on business phone icon. Normal behavior redirects to the device Phone app. Issue behavior, no actions occur. Please see screenshot of the business phone icon below:

 In our investigation, we have found that this is likely caused by the following filter rule:

||ssl.pstatic.net/tveta/libs.

 

We believe it is blocking a network resource allowing this functionality, specifically the following file: https://ssl.pstatic.net/tveta/libs/ssp/ssp.web.sdk.js.

Whitelisting the entire domain (ie. @@||ssl.pstatic.net) manually fixes this issue.

We would like to ask if you could please investigate this further as we are receiving comments from users asking why the phone button is not working in Naver search.

Please let us know if there are any further updates regarding this matter.

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
@Eugene-Savenko reproduced on your end? As I recall, this was fixed on our end and then by `List-KR`.
Actually, can't reproduce it. @piquark6046 could you take a look?

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

```
##.adbadge:not(#filter_ads_by_classname)

##.BannerAd:not(#filter_ads_by_classname)

```
to fix the anti adblock globally?

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 10 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

AdGuard Browser Extension ### AdGuard version Version 4.0.163 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Missed ads or ad leftovers ### Which browser(s) do you use? Chrome ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? https://www.producthunt.com/alternatives/sourcery-4 ### What filters do you have enabled? AdGuard Base filter ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

labels.name: List-KR
labels.description: Problematic issues, handled in List-KR

issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [X] Browser version is up-to-date; - [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard Content Blocker ### AdGuard version 2.7.0 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Website or app doesn't work properly ### Which browser(s) do you use? other(specify in comment below) ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? Naver ### What filters do you have enabled? ---Third-party filters--- ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots When enabling List-KR filter list and AdGuard adblocker on Samsung Internet and accessing Naver site, the button with phone icon does not navigate to the device Phone app. This issue can be replicated as follows:
Screenshot: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15856304/171390222-9617c2c7-0534-479c-9470-ee16285c85e4.png)

1. Open Samsung Internet and enable Adguard with List-KR enabled 2. Go to m.naver.com, type "ì‚¼ì„±ì „ìž ì„œë¹„ìŠ¤ì„¼í„° ì „í™”ë²ˆí˜¸" in the search bar and click the Search button/press Enter 3. Click on business phone icon. Normal behavior redirects to the device Phone app. Issue behavior, no actions occur. Please see screenshot of the business phone icon below: In our investigation, we have found that this is likely caused by the following filter rule: ||ssl.pstatic.net/tveta/libs. We believe it is blocking a network resource allowing this functionality, specifically the following file: https://ssl.pstatic.net/tveta/libs/ssp/ssp.web.sdk.js. Whitelisting the entire domain (ie. @@||ssl.pstatic.net) manually fixes this issue. We would like to ask if you could please investigate this further as we are receiving comments from users asking why the phone button is not working in Naver search. Please let us know if there are any further updates regarding this matter. ### Privacy - [X] I agree to follow this condition

issue.title: fix anti adblock on francaisfacile.net

comment.body:
If I'm not wrong, this script is also checking if `pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/js/adsbygoogle.js` is blocked, so we would need also to add generic redirect rule. And if there are exceptions for these element hiding rules, then we will have to modify them too.

What if we would just add:
```
##div[id^="chp_ads_block"][class*="chp_ads_blocker_detector"]
```
as a generic rule.
It should be enough in most cases (sometimes scroll is blocked, but it seems that it's not so often).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
Okay, so it turns out the entry I used, doesn't actually remove the appendage. Instead DeepL just stops the appending after 4 page reloads or so, which made me falsely think I had stopped it.

I'm not impressed by DeepL's strategy with that, to be frank.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 10 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
